alert.note: Alert for Benton; Crawford; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:29AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Benton, northwestern Crawford, Washington, southeastern Craig, Delaware, southern Ottawa, northeastern Mayes and northeastern Adair Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 229 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ketchum to 2 miles southwest of Decatur to near Chester. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Siloam Springs... Vinita... Jay... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Bella Vista... Lowell... Grove... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Gentry... Elkins... Tontitown... Gravette... West Fork... Lincoln... This includes the following highways, Interstate 44 between mile markers 283 and 306. Interstate 49 between mile markers 35 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
